article: How to Respond to a "How Was Your Day?" Text
intro: Itâ€™s nearing the end of the day, your phone dings and a â€œHow was your day?â€ text stares back at you. Maybe itâ€™s from your crush, best friend, or even your parent. They just want to check in, but how do you respond? Whether youâ€™ve had a good or bad day, weâ€™ve got you covered! Keep reading to learn how you can respond on any type of day to just about anyone.

steps.subtitle: Even if all you did today was chill out on the couch, fill them in on the deets! If theyâ€™re sending you this message, chances are they want to chat. Youâ€™re sparking a conversation by replying with what you did todayâ€”even if you think itâ€™s boring.

steps.title: Send this positive and polite message to a friend or acquaintance.
steps.subtitle: They didnâ€™t have to check in on you, so thank them for thinking of you. Send them a , whether this is someone youâ€™re close with or someone youâ€™re just getting to know. You can even add an extra â€œHow was your day?â€ to the end of your text to keep the conversation going.

steps.subtitle: Maybe youâ€™re texting an acquaintance, coworker, or even a friend you havenâ€™t seen in years. You donâ€™t want to get too personal just yet, so stick to a generic response and remember to ask how theyâ€™re doing. Texting can be a great way to get to know someone better, so keep asking questions and see how fast you can become friends.

steps.title: This is a great text to send a friend or .
steps.subtitle: If you donâ€™t necessarily want to talk about how you feel about your day, segue the conversation in another direction. Comment about something you did or learned in the day. Chances are theyâ€™re going to want to know more and will ask you questions on the new topic.

steps.title: If theyâ€™re someone you trust, be honest.
steps.subtitle: Maybe youâ€™ve had a terrific day, an okay day, or a downright terrible day. Either way, if this is a close friend or family member, ask them how they are in return. This is a great way to start a conversation, and who knows? A nice convo with a friend might be the best way to turn a not-so-great day around.

steps.title: Reply to a boss or coworker with this message.
steps.subtitle: This is a great way to be a prompt worker and show youâ€™re on task. Fill them in on how the workday went, offering any information they may need to know. Keep the text short and to the point. You want to remain professional, so reread your message before hitting send.
